divs: Sighting DetailsOn a roving guard ,attached to the 2nd Bn.5th CAV 1st CAV DIV,on the Saudi -Iraqborder, it was getting close to the next one hour guard rotation.I sat under acamoflauge canopy,to wait the few minutes left.I had an M16,an M60with noammo,night vision goggles,and a field telephonePR-77.I used none of these duringthe event.As I waited,a very bright light approached behind me.I assumed it tobe a groud vehicle.The light emmitted was irridescent,every color of therainbow,simultaneously.The vehicle came closer,then I realized it wasairborne.As it began to pass behind me,I turned up the level on my biclighter,and lit a cigarette,leaving the lighter lit for maybe 30 seconds.Thecraft immediately turned off its bottom mounted beacon,and began to pan aroundin front of me.It was maybe 30 feet away,and maybe 25 feet off the ground,belowradar detection capability,I think. It was completely silent,and gave off someform of energy signature,which I felt. Then it slowly began to gyroscopicallyoscillate,faster and faster,until it became like a round object.Before that,itresembled a disc,with a cupola,a segmented leading edge,and a beacon on thebottom.Then it stopped oscillating.The following lights appeared,in thisorderThe lights were the size of a half dollar.Three lights in the form of atriangle.Four lights in the shape of a rectangle, then one pinpoint light,whichstretched in two opposing directions,approximately four-six feet long.I felthypnotized,but not afraid.In fact ,I outstretched my right arm towards it,straining every muscle in my arm. The next thing I remember is walking back tothe platoons tent,after the disc floated north,towards Iraq. My watch showedthat over an hour had passed,yet it only seemed like two or three minutes.
